      VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chrome Version: 105<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 105<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>It gets an unknown crash with READ of size 8 when first accessing the chrome://gpu URL with a chrome extension<span class="line"><!---->It gets an unknown crash with READ of size 8 when first accessing the chrome://gpu URL with a chrome extension<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>== background.js<span class="line"><!---->== background.js<!----></span><br><br>chrome.windows.create({ url: 'about:blank' }, (win) => {<span class="line"><!---->chrome.windows.create({ url: 'about:blank' }, (win) =&gt; {<!----></span><br>    chrome.tabs.update(win.tabs[0].id, { url: 'chrome://gpu' });<span class="line"><!---->    chrome.tabs.update(win.tabs[0].id, { url: 'chrome://gpu' });<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>It seems to consistently crash the GPU process on any first navigation to chrome://gpu<span class="line"><!---->It seems to consistently crash the GPU process on any first navigation to chrome://gpu<!----></span><br>I think it's just a weird thing with WebGPU. I can repro on Canary and Dev which have WebGPU enabled on my machine, but can't repro on Beta which has WebGPU disabled by default<span class="line"><!---->I think it's just a weird thing with WebGPU. I can repro on Canary and Dev which have WebGPU enabled on my machine, but can't repro on Beta which has WebGPU disabled by default<!----></span><br><br>REQUEST FOR CC:<span class="line"><!---->REQUEST FOR CC:<!----></span><br><br>Please CC <span class="line"><!---->Please CC <!----></span>alesandro@alesandroortiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alesandro@alesandroortiz.com"><!---->alesandro@alesandroortiz.com<!----></a> here in this report if this report go forward. He's mentoring me.<span class="line"><!----> here in this report if this report go forward. He's mentoring me.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Vitor Torres <<span class="line"><!---->Vitor Torres &lt;<!----></span>https://github.com/vtorres/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/vtorres/"><!---->https://github.com/vtorres/<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!<!----></span><br><br>It'd help us a lot if you could attach all of the files needed for the reproduction (i.e. the extension manifest, etc.). It'd also help a lot if you could work on providing a *symbolized* stack trace.<span class="line"><!---->It'd help us a lot if you could attach all of the files needed for the reproduction (i.e. the extension manifest, etc.). It'd also help a lot if you could work on providing a *symbolized* stack trace.<!----></span><br><br>I can't reproduce this without the extension, and if that's all the extension is doing, I'd be pretty surprised if this impacted real users. Extensions have extremely limited capabilities on chrome:// URLs (including an inability to open them at all).<span class="line"><!---->I can't reproduce this without the extension, and if that's all the extension is doing, I'd be pretty surprised if this impacted real users. Extensions have extremely limited capabilities on chrome:// URLs (including an inability to open them at all).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        On my Windows machine (Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2006)) , this repros on ASan build 1058972 + 108.0.5355.0 Dev + 109.0.5364.0 Canary, but doesn't repro on 107.0.5304.36 Beta nor 106.0.5249.119 Stable.<span class="line"><!---->On my Windows machine (Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2006)) , this repros on ASan build 1058972 + 108.0.5355.0 Dev + 109.0.5364.0 Canary, but doesn't repro on 107.0.5304.36 Beta nor 106.0.5249.119 Stable.<!----></span><br><br>I'm able to reproduce this on Windows simply by going to chrome://gpu after loading a fresh browser instance, but only get the following from ASan:<span class="line"><!---->I'm able to reproduce this on Windows simply by going to chrome://gpu after loading a fresh browser instance, but only get the following from ASan:<!----></span><br>[7584:10084:1017/194641.304:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(990)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=1<span class="line"><!---->[7584:10084:1017/194641.304:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(990)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=1<!----></span><br><br>When this occurs, the Chrome window is mostly black as well for a few seconds (typical of a GPU process crash).<span class="line"><!---->When this occurs, the Chrome window is mostly black as well for a few seconds (typical of a GPU process crash).<!----></span><br><br>If you try navigating to chrome://gpu after a repro, it won't repro until you restart the browser instance again.<span class="line"><!---->If you try navigating to chrome://gpu after a repro, it won't repro until you restart the browser instance again.<!----></span><br><br>I'm actually not certain if this is related to WebGPU, because now my Canary instance shows WebGPU as disabled but it still repros there. (A couple of days there seemed to be a correlation between WebGPU being enabled and the crash.)<span class="line"><!---->I'm actually not certain if this is related to WebGPU, because now my Canary instance shows WebGPU as disabled but it still repros there. (A couple of days there seemed to be a correlation between WebGPU being enabled and the crash.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 11<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 3, 2022, 8:09 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 3, 2022, 8:09 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-High OS-Linux Pri-1
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-High OS-Linux Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This seems to be a GPU process crash. It's unclear whether this can be triggered by a remote attacker, but I'm provisionally assigning severity high. If it can only be triggered locally, please let us know.<span class="line"><!---->This seems to be a GPU process crash. It's unclear whether this can be triggered by a remote attacker, but I'm provisionally assigning severity high. If it can only be triggered locally, please let us know.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        It can be triggered by an extension (or anything else) opening chrome://gpu for the first time since browser was opened, so only apparent prerequisites are installing a malicious extension and that chrome://gpu hasn't been opened since browser was opened (it's very likely this is met or could be met in the near future since extensions can try again when browser is restarted).<span class="line"><!---->It can be triggered by an extension (or anything else) opening chrome://gpu for the first time since browser was opened, so only apparent prerequisites are installing a malicious extension and that chrome://gpu hasn't been opened since browser was opened (it's very likely this is met or could be met in the near future since extensions can try again when browser is restarted).<!----></span><br><br>Since it's still being analyzed, there's a chance this is only a stability issue, right? Or is it confirmed to be a security issue?<span class="line"><!---->Since it's still being analyzed, there's a chance this is only a stability issue, right? Or is it confirmed to be a security issue?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #c27<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c27"><!---->#c27<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>And because the one-time check is only on the method used by chrome://gpu<span class="line"><!---->And because the one-time check is only on the method used by chrome://gpu<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/gpu/gpu_data_manager_impl_private.cc;l=815;drc=603337a74bf04efd536b251a7f2b4eb44fe153a9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/gpu/gpu_data_manager_impl_private.cc;l=815;drc=603337a74bf04efd536b251a7f2b4eb44fe153a9"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/gpu/gpu_data_manager_impl_private.cc;l=815;drc=603337a74bf04efd536b251a7f2b4eb44fe153a9<!----></a><br><br>Visiting links can trigger the OOB many times because it's outside of chrome://gpu one-time check<span class="line"><!---->Visiting links can trigger the OOB many times because it's outside of chrome://gpu one-time check<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        Thank you for this report and your efforts, Vitor and Alesandro. In evaluating this issue, we don't see any demonstrable evidence of the OOB read. The fix itself is purely a functional fix and we aren't able to see how this is could be exploited. If you can provide some sort of evidence demonstrating the OOB memory access, such as a symbolized stack trace, we would be happy to reassess, but for now we are unable to extend a reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report and your efforts, Vitor and Alesandro. In evaluating this issue, we don't see any demonstrable evidence of the OOB read. The fix itself is purely a functional fix and we aren't able to see how this is could be exploited. If you can provide some sort of evidence demonstrating the OOB memory access, such as a symbolized stack trace, we would be happy to reassess, but for now we are unable to extend a reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

          </chops-button>

          </chops-button>

      </form>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          padding: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;

          }

            min-height: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <mr-edit-description id="edit-description"></mr-edit-description>
        <mr-move-copy-issue id="move-copy-issue"></mr-move-copy-issue>
        <mr-convert-issue id="convert-issue"></mr-convert-issue>
        <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>
        <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-page>
        <!----></main>
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>
    <!----></mr-app>


        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    text-decoration: underline;

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;

    filter: brightness(95%);

    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  }

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;

            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

      <div class="select-container">
        <i class="material-icons" role="presentation">arrow_drop_down</i>
        <select id="can" name="can" aria-label="Search scope">
          <optgroup label="Search within">
            <option value="1" selected="">All issues</option>
            <option value="2">Open issues</option>
            <option value="3">Open and owned by me</option>
            <option value="4">Open and reported by me</option>

            </option>
          </optgroup>
          <optgroup label="My saved queries" hidden="">
            
            <option data-href="/u//queries">
              Manage my saved queries...
            </option>
          </optgroup>
        </select>
      </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chrome Version: 105<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 105<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>It gets an unknown crash with READ of size 8 when first accessing the chrome://gpu URL with a chrome extension<span class="line"><!---->It gets an unknown crash with READ of size 8 when first accessing the chrome://gpu URL with a chrome extension<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>== background.js<span class="line"><!---->== background.js<!----></span><br><br>chrome.windows.create({ url: 'about:blank' }, (win) => {<span class="line"><!---->chrome.windows.create({ url: 'about:blank' }, (win) =&gt; {<!----></span><br>    chrome.tabs.update(win.tabs[0].id, { url: 'chrome://gpu' });<span class="line"><!---->    chrome.tabs.update(win.tabs[0].id, { url: 'chrome://gpu' });<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>It seems to consistently crash the GPU process on any first navigation to chrome://gpu<span class="line"><!---->It seems to consistently crash the GPU process on any first navigation to chrome://gpu<!----></span><br>I think it's just a weird thing with WebGPU. I can repro on Canary and Dev which have WebGPU enabled on my machine, but can't repro on Beta which has WebGPU disabled by default<span class="line"><!---->I think it's just a weird thing with WebGPU. I can repro on Canary and Dev which have WebGPU enabled on my machine, but can't repro on Beta which has WebGPU disabled by default<!----></span><br><br>REQUEST FOR CC:<span class="line"><!---->REQUEST FOR CC:<!----></span><br><br>Please CC <span class="line"><!---->Please CC <!----></span>alesandro@alesandroortiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alesandro@alesandroortiz.com"><!---->alesandro@alesandroortiz.com<!----></a> here in this report if this report go forward. He's mentoring me.<span class="line"><!----> here in this report if this report go forward. He's mentoring me.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Vitor Torres <<span class="line"><!---->Vitor Torres &lt;<!----></span>https://github.com/vtorres/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/vtorres/"><!---->https://github.com/vtorres/<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!<!----></span><br><br>It'd help us a lot if you could attach all of the files needed for the reproduction (i.e. the extension manifest, etc.). It'd also help a lot if you could work on providing a *symbolized* stack trace.<span class="line"><!---->It'd help us a lot if you could attach all of the files needed for the reproduction (i.e. the extension manifest, etc.). It'd also help a lot if you could work on providing a *symbolized* stack trace.<!----></span><br><br>I can't reproduce this without the extension, and if that's all the extension is doing, I'd be pretty surprised if this impacted real users. Extensions have extremely limited capabilities on chrome:// URLs (including an inability to open them at all).<span class="line"><!---->I can't reproduce this without the extension, and if that's all the extension is doing, I'd be pretty surprised if this impacted real users. Extensions have extremely limited capabilities on chrome:// URLs (including an inability to open them at all).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        On my Windows machine (Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2006)) , this repros on ASan build 1058972 + 108.0.5355.0 Dev + 109.0.5364.0 Canary, but doesn't repro on 107.0.5304.36 Beta nor 106.0.5249.119 Stable.<span class="line"><!---->On my Windows machine (Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2006)) , this repros on ASan build 1058972 + 108.0.5355.0 Dev + 109.0.5364.0 Canary, but doesn't repro on 107.0.5304.36 Beta nor 106.0.5249.119 Stable.<!----></span><br><br>I'm able to reproduce this on Windows simply by going to chrome://gpu after loading a fresh browser instance, but only get the following from ASan:<span class="line"><!---->I'm able to reproduce this on Windows simply by going to chrome://gpu after loading a fresh browser instance, but only get the following from ASan:<!----></span><br>[7584:10084:1017/194641.304:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(990)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=1<span class="line"><!---->[7584:10084:1017/194641.304:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(990)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=1<!----></span><br><br>When this occurs, the Chrome window is mostly black as well for a few seconds (typical of a GPU process crash).<span class="line"><!---->When this occurs, the Chrome window is mostly black as well for a few seconds (typical of a GPU process crash).<!----></span><br><br>If you try navigating to chrome://gpu after a repro, it won't repro until you restart the browser instance again.<span class="line"><!---->If you try navigating to chrome://gpu after a repro, it won't repro until you restart the browser instance again.<!----></span><br><br>I'm actually not certain if this is related to WebGPU, because now my Canary instance shows WebGPU as disabled but it still repros there. (A couple of days there seemed to be a correlation between WebGPU being enabled and the crash.)<span class="line"><!---->I'm actually not certain if this is related to WebGPU, because now my Canary instance shows WebGPU as disabled but it still repros there. (A couple of days there seemed to be a correlation between WebGPU being enabled and the crash.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 3, 2022, 10:01 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 3, 2022, 10:01 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        It can be triggered by an extension (or anything else) opening chrome://gpu for the first time since browser was opened, so only apparent prerequisites are installing a malicious extension and that chrome://gpu hasn't been opened since browser was opened (it's very likely this is met or could be met in the near future since extensions can try again when browser is restarted).<span class="line"><!---->It can be triggered by an extension (or anything else) opening chrome://gpu for the first time since browser was opened, so only apparent prerequisites are installing a malicious extension and that chrome://gpu hasn't been opened since browser was opened (it's very likely this is met or could be met in the near future since extensions can try again when browser is restarted).<!----></span><br><br>Since it's still being analyzed, there's a chance this is only a stability issue, right? Or is it confirmed to be a security issue?<span class="line"><!---->Since it's still being analyzed, there's a chance this is only a stability issue, right? Or is it confirmed to be a security issue?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        actually - this UNREACHABLE is probably the problem. If indeed an error is happening here and the code is reached, the compiler will make a false assumption which could lead to unexpected behavior. putting up <span class="line"><!---->actually - this UNREACHABLE is probably the problem.         Regression would have been introduced in this CL: <span class="line"><!---->Regression would have been introduced in this CL: <!----></span>https://dawn-review.googlesource.com/c/dawn/+/104360<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://dawn-review.googlesource.com/c/dawn/+/104360"><!---->https://dawn-review.googlesource.com/c/dawn/+/104360<!----></a><br>that's when UNREACHABLE is added. So that would be starting in M108.<span class="line"><!---->that's when UNREACHABLE is added. So that would be starting in M108.<!----></span><br><br>That confuses me a bit though. The original report says that this was crashing in M105 and M106<span class="line"><!---->That confuses me a bit though. The original report says that this was crashing in M105 and M106<!----></span><br>M105 and M106 don't have UNREACHABLE there.<span class="line"><!---->M105 and M106 don't have UNREACHABLE there.<!----></span><br><br>https://dawn.googlesource.com/dawn.git/+/refs/heads/chromium/5195/src/dawn/native/vulkan/BackendVk.cpp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://dawn.googlesource.com/dawn.git/+/refs/heads/chromium/5195/src/dawn/native/vulkan/BackendVk.cpp"><!---->https://dawn.googlesource.com/dawn.git/+/refs/heads/chromium/5195/src/dawn/native/vulkan/BackendVk.cpp<!----></a><br>https://dawn.googlesource.com/dawn.git/+/refs/heads/chromium/5249/src/dawn/native/vulkan/BackendVk.cpp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://dawn.googlesource.com/dawn.git/+/refs/heads/chromium/5249/src/dawn/native/vulkan/BackendVk.cpp"><!---->https://dawn.googlesource.com/dawn.git/+/refs/heads/chromium/5249/src/dawn/native/vulkan/BackendVk.cpp<!----></a><br><br>UNREACHABLE is a macro for __builtin_unreachable()<span class="line"><!---->UNREACHABLE is a macro for __builtin_unreachable()<!----></span><br>hard to say exactly what is happening without looking at the assembly, but it could be that the compiler assumes it'll never reach this code, so it doesn't even emit the code to return from the function.<span class="line"><!---->hard to say exactly what is happening without looking at the assembly, but it could be that the compiler assumes it'll never reach this code, so it doesn't even emit the code to return from the function.<!----></span><br>And so what happens instead is that when running code, the process will just go on and start executing whatever instructions are at the next addresses.<span class="line"><!---->And so what happens instead is that when running code, the process will just go on and start executing whatever instructions are at the next addresses.<!----></span><br><br>Is this reachable outside of chrome://gpu?<span class="line"><!---->Is this reachable outside of chrome://gpu?<!----></span><br>I think it would happen as well if you try to use WebGPU on any page (that has WebGPU enabled; it's not enabled by default on Linux so perhaps this is irrelevant).<span class="line"><!---->I think it would happen as well if you try to use WebGPU on any page (that has WebGPU enabled; it's not enabled by default on         Thank you for this report and your efforts, Vitor and Alesandro. In evaluating this issue, we don't see any demonstrable evidence of the OOB read. The fix itself is purely a functional fix and we aren't able to see how this is could be exploited. If you can provide some sort of evidence demonstrating the OOB memory access, such as a symbolized stack trace, we would be happy to reassess, but for now we are unable to extend a reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report and your efforts, Vitor and Alesandro. In evaluating this issue, we don't see any demonstrable evidence of the OOB read. The fix itself is purely a functional fix and we aren't able to see how this is could be exploited. If you can provide some sort of evidence demonstrating the OOB memory access, such as a symbolized stack trace, we would be happy to reassess, but for now we are unable to extend a reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1375131: Security: Unknown crash with READ of size 8 when access the chrome://gpu with WebGPU enabled
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1375131: Security: Unknown crash with READ of size 8 when access the chrome://gpu with WebGPU enabled
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      vitor...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/4174802449" title="vitor...@gmail.com"><!---->vitor...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      vitor...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->vitor...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

            on

    <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Oct 16, 2022, 7:40 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chrome Version: 105<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 105<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>It gets an unknown crash with READ of size 8 when first accessing the chrome://gpu URL with a chrome extension<span class="line"><!---->It gets an unknown crash with READ of size 8 when first accessing the chrome://gpu URL with a chrome extension<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>== background.js<span class="line"><!---->== background.js<!----></span><br><br>chrome.windows.create({ url: 'about:blank' }, (win) => {<span class="line"><!---->chrome.windows.create({ url: 'about:blank' }, (win) =&gt; {<!----></span><br>    chrome.tabs.update(win.tabs[0].id, { url: 'chrome://gpu' });<span class="line"><!---->    chrome.tabs.update(win.tabs[0].id, { url: 'chrome://gpu' });<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>It seems to consistently crash the GPU process on any first navigation to chrome://gpu<span class="line"><!---->It seems to consistently crash the GPU process on any first navigation to chrome://gpu<!----></span><br>I think it's just a weird thing with WebGPU. I can repro on Canary and Dev which have WebGPU enabled on my machine, but can't repro on Beta which has WebGPU disabled by default<span class="line"><!---->I think it's just a weird thing with WebGPU. I can repro on Canary and Dev which have WebGPU enabled on my machine, but can't repro on Beta which has WebGPU disabled by default<!----></span><br><br>REQUEST FOR CC:<span class="line"><!---->REQUEST FOR CC:<!----></span><br><br>Please CC <span class="line"><!---->Please CC <!----></span>alesandro@alesandroortiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/alesandro@alesandroortiz.com"><!---->alesandro@alesandroortiz.com<!----></a> here in this report if this report go forward. He's mentoring me.<span class="line"><!----> here in this report if this report go forward. He's mentoring me.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br><br>Vitor Torres <<span class="line"><!---->Vitor Torres &lt;<!----></span>https://github.com/vtorres/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/vtorres/"><!---->https://github.com/vtorres/<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!<!----></span><br><br>It'd help us a lot if you could attach all of the files needed for the reproduction (i.e. the extension manifest, etc.). It'd also help a lot if you could work on providing a *symbolized* stack trace.<span class="line"><!---->It'd help us a lot if you could attach all of the files needed for the reproduction (i.e. the extension manifest, etc.). It'd also help a lot if you could work on providing a *symbolized* stack trace.<!----></span><br><br>I can't reproduce this without the extension, and if that's all the extension is doing, I'd be pretty surprised if this impacted real users. Extensions have extremely limited capabilities on chrome:// URLs (including an inability to open them at all).<span class="line"><!---->I can't reproduce this without the extension, and if that's all the extension is doing, I'd be pretty surprised if this impacted real users.         On my Windows machine (Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2006)) , this repros on ASan build 1058972 + 108.0.5355.0 Dev + 109.0.5364.0 Canary, but doesn't repro on 107.0.5304.36 Beta nor 106.0.5249.119 Stable.<span class="line"><!---->On my Windows machine (Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2006)) , this repros on ASan build 1058972 + 108.0.5355.0 Dev + 109.0.5364.0 Canary, but doesn't repro on 107.0.5304.36 Beta nor 106.0.5249.119 Stable.<!----></span><br><br>I'm able to reproduce this on Windows simply by going to chrome://gpu after loading a fresh browser instance, but only get the following from ASan:<span class="line"><!---->I'm able to reproduce this on Windows simply by going to chrome://gpu after loading a fresh browser instance, but only get the following from ASan:<!----></span><br>[7584:10084:1017/194641.304:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(990)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=1<span class="line"><!---->[7584:10084:1017/194641.304:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(990)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=1<!----></span><br><br>When this occurs, the Chrome window is mostly black as well for a few seconds (typical of a GPU process crash).<span class="line"><!---->When this occurs, the Chrome window is mostly black as well for a few seconds (typical of a GPU process crash).<!----></span><br><br>If you try navigating to chrome://gpu after a repro, it won't repro until you restart the browser instance again.<span class="line"><!---->If you try navigating to chrome://gpu after a repro, it won't repro until you restart the browser instance again.<!----></span><br><br>I'm actually not certain if this is related to WebGPU, because now my Canary instance shows WebGPU as disabled but it still repros there. (A couple of days there seemed to be a correlation between WebGPU being enabled and the crash.)<span class="line"><!---->I'm actually not certain if this is related to WebGPU, because now my Canary instance shows WebGPU as disabled but it still repros there. (A couple of days there seemed to be a correlation between WebGPU being enabled and the crash.)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 11<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 3, 2022, 8:09 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 3, 2022, 8:09 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1375131#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Nov 3, 2022, 8:09 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-High OS-Linux Pri-1
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-High OS-Linux Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This seems to be a GPU process crash. It's unclear whether this can be triggered by a remote attacker, but I'm provisionally assigning severity high. If it can only be triggered locally, please let us know.<span class="line"><!---->This seems to be a GPU process crash. It's unclear whether this can be triggered by a remote attacker, but I'm provisionally assigning severity high. If it can only be triggered locally, please let us know.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        It can be triggered by an extension (or anything else) opening chrome://gpu for the first time since browser was opened, so only apparent prerequisites are installing a malicious extension and that chrome://gpu hasn't been opened since browser was opened (it's very likely this is met or could be met in the near future since extensions can try again when browser is restarted).<span class="line"><!---->It can be triggered by an extension (or anything else) opening chrome://gpu for the first time since browser was opened, so only apparent prerequisites are installing a malicious extension and that chrome://gpu hasn't been opened since browser was opened (it's very likely this is met or could be met in the near future since extensions can try again when browser is restarted).<!----></span><br><br>Since it's still being analyzed, there's a chance this is only a stability issue, right? Or is it confirmed to be a security issue?<span class="line"><!---->Since it's still being analyzed, there's a chance this is only a stability issue, right? Or is it confirmed to be a security issue?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        #c27<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c27"><!---->#c27<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>And because the one-time check is only on the method used by chrome://gpu<span class="line"><!---->And because the one-time check is only on the method used by chrome://gpu<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/gpu/gpu_data_manager_impl_private.cc;l=815;drc=603337a74bf04efd536b251a7f2b4eb44fe153a9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/gpu/gpu_data_manager_impl_private.cc;l=815;drc=603337a74bf04efd536b251a7f2b4eb44fe153a9"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/gpu/gpu_data_manager_impl_private.cc;l=815;drc=603337a74bf04efd536b251a7f2b4eb44fe153a9<!----></a><br><br>Visiting links can trigger the OOB many times because it's outside of chrome://gpu one-time check<span class="line"><!---->Visiting links can trigger the OOB many times because it's outside of chrome://gpu one-time check<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        Thank you for this report and your efforts, Vitor and Alesandro. In evaluating this issue, we don't see any demonstrable evidence of the OOB read. The fix itself is purely a functional fix and we aren't able to see how this is could be exploited. If you can provide some sort of evidence demonstrating the OOB memory access, such as a symbolized stack trace, we would be happy to reassess, but for now we are unable to extend a reward for this report.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for this report and your efforts, Vitor and Alesandro. In evaluating this issue, we don't see any demonstrable evidence of the OOB read. The fix itself is purely a functional fix and we aren't able to see how this is could be exploited. If you can provide some sort of evidence demonstrating the OOB memory access, such as a symbolized stack trace, we would be happy to reassess, but for now we are unable to extend a reward for this report.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
